NEW PAGE 121
CHAPTER 8: SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS
H. All animals awaiting processing are to be housed within a fully enclosed structure.
I.
All inedible offal, meat that is not food, condemned material and refuse of the meat processing shall
be refrigerated and stored in the interior of a full enclosed structure until time of pick-up or final
disposal.
Section 8.7 Automotive, Boat, Recreational Vehicles (RV), Heavy Equipment,
Manufactured Home Sales and/or Service and Commercial Parking Lots
A. Large surface parking lots & display areas should be visually and functionally segmented into several
smaller lots. The size of any single surface parking lot or display area shall be limited to three (3) acres,
unless divided by a street, principal building, or an opaque screen/buffer. Parking lots and display areas
shall be paved. Street-facing parking lot and display areas shall have a Street Planting Yard installed
as described in Section 11.3.4
B. No outdoor sound system shall be permitted which can be heard beyond the boundaries of the property.
C. Shall comply with all applicable provisions of this ordinance, including but not limited to Chapter 8
Parking and Infrastructure.
D. Commercial parking lots, as a primary use, shall require Conditional Rezoning a Special Use Permit in
the CB District.
Section 8.8 Bed and Breakfast Homes and Inns
A bed & breakfast home is a use that takes place within a building that prior to such an establishment, was
a single-family residence, that consists of renting from one (1) to eight (8) dwelling rooms on a daily basis
to tourists, vacationers, and business travelers, where meals are provided only to guests. A bed & breakfast
inn is a business establishment of more than nine (9) guest rooms that offers bed and breakfast
accommodations to at least nine but not more than twenty-three (23) persons.
A. Single family homes used as bed and breakfast homes shall have a minimum heated floor area of 1,500
square feet.
B. The maximum number of guest bedrooms for each proposed bed and breakfast home shall be four (4)
unless the applicant can demonstrate that the original floor plan of the structure contained a larger
number of bedrooms, in which case, the original number of bedrooms may be approved as allowable
guest lodging. In no case shall the number of guests exceed eight (8). The maximum number of
guest bedrooms for each proposed bed and breakfast inn shall be nine (9).
C. The home or inn shall be operated by a resident manager (shall be a full-time resident).
D. All guest parking shall be to the rear of the home. There shall be one parking space per room of lodging.
E. Signs for bed and breakfast homes and inns shall be limited to one ground sign per establishment. Such
sign shall not exceed five (5) square feet unless approved by the Zoning Administrator. The sign shall
8-6
Town of China Grove Unified Development Ordinance

NEW PAGE 122
CHAPTER 8: SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS
not be illuminated and shall be an identification sign only. Location of sign shall be governed by
Chapter 11 Signs. No advertising signs of any nature shall be permitted.
F. Bed and breakfast homes shall be located in a structure which was originally constructed as a dwelling.
G. The use shall contain only one (1) kitchen facility. Meals served on the premises shall be only for
overnight guests and residents of the facility.
H. The use of such a facility by any one patron shall be limited to no more than 15 days per 60-day period.
Section 8.9 Boarding Houses
A. The maximum number of guest bedrooms for each proposed boarding house shall be four (4) unless
the applicant can demonstrate that the original floor plan of the structure contained a larger number of
bedrooms, in which case, the original number of bedrooms may be approved as allowable guest
lodging. In no case shall the number of guest rooms exceed eight (8).
B. The boarding house shall be operated by a resident manager.
C.
The use shall be located in a structure which was originally constructed as a dwelling.
D.
The use shall contain only one (1) kitchen facility. Meals served on the premises shall be only for
overnight guests and residents of the facility.
E. All resident parking shall be to the rear of the home. There shall be one parking space per room of
residency.
F.
Signs for boarding houses shall be limited to one ground sign per establishment. Such sign shall not
exceed five (5) square feet and shall not be illuminated and shall be an identification sign only.
Location of sign shall be governed by Chapter 11 Signs. No advertising signs of any nature shall be
permitted.
Section 8.10 Cemeteries
A. Tombstones, crypts, monuments, and mausoleums shall be located a minimum of 20 feet from any side
or rear lot line and at least 30 feet from a street right-of-way.
B. Adequate off-street parking/circulation facilities for funeral procession shall be provided.
C. Site plans shall also include entrances and exits, pattern of internal circulation and storm drainage.
D. Cemeteries shall have direct access to a major or minor thoroughfare.
8-7
Town of China Grove Unified Development Ordinance

NEW PAGE 123
CHAPTER 8: SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS
Section 8.11 Child Care Centers
A. Daycares and preschools shall be located on lots which provide ample outdoor play area. A fenced area
in the rear yard or side yard a minimum of 2,500 square feet shall be provided. Fences shall be a
minimum of six (6) feet in height. Daycares and preschools located adjacent to parks are exempt from
this provision.
B. All play equipment shall be located in the fenced area. Front yards shall not be used as playground
areas.
C. Operating hours shall be limited to 6:00 am and 7:00 p.m. (This requirement applicable only to day
care operations in residential zoning districts.)
D. Services shall not be provided for any client on a continuous 24-hour basis.
E.
Minimum parking shall be one (1) space per facility vehicle, (1) space per employee, plus two (2) per
15 children. Also, at least one off-street passenger loading and unloading space separate from the
parking area, plus adequate turnaround area shall be provided. Minimum parking for in-home daycares
may be reduced to one (1) space per facility vehicle, one (1) space per employee, and two (2) additional
spaces.
F. There may be one (1) freestanding monument sign erected per public street frontage. The sign(s) for
centers located in Non-Residential Zoning Districts shall not exceed three (3) feet in height and fifteen
(15) sq. ft. in sign area when located within ten (10) feet of the right-of-way. When located more than
ten (10) feet from the right-of-way, the sign(s) shall not exceed five (5) feet in height and fifteen (15)
sq. ft. in sign area. The sign(s) for centers located in Residential Zoning District shall not exceed four
(4) sq. Ft.
G. All required State, Federal, and/or County licenses and permits shall be obtained by the operator of the
day care center.
H. Facilities permitted in any residential district shall maintain the character and appearance of a
residential use.
I. Child Care Facilities must meet the standards provided by the Child Day Care Commission. Evidence
that Commission requirements are met shall be presented to the Zoning Administrator prior to any
Certificate of Zoning Compliance being issued.
Section 8.12 Drinking Places (Alcoholic Beverages)
A. No bar, nightclub, or dance hall shall be permitted within 100 feet of any one- or two-family primary
residential dwelling unit, church, or other civic use building, nor shall a drinking place be located within
100 feet of any other drinking establishment. The restriction of this subsection is not applicable within
the C-B zoning district for structures which front Main Street.
B. Flashing lights or fluttering devices designed and used to attract attention are not permitted.
C. Music or other amplified sound shall not be audible beyond the property line.
8-8

CHAPTER 8: SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS
Section 8.11 Child Care Centers
A. Daycares and preschools shall be located on lots which provide ample outdoor play area. A fenced area
in the rear yard or side yard a minimum of 2,500 square feet shall be provided. Fences shall be a
minimum of six (6) feet in height. Daycares and preschools located adjacent to parks are exempt from
this provision.
B. All play equipment shall be located in the fenced area. Front yards shall not be used as playground
areas.
C. Operating hours shall be limited to 6:00 am and 7:00 p.m. (This requirement applicable only to day
care operations in residential zoning districts.)
D. Services shall not be provided for any client on a continuous 24-hour basis.
E.
Minimum parking shall be one (1) space per facility vehicle, (1) space per employee, plus two (2) per
15 children. Also, at least one off-street passenger loading and unloading space separate from the
parking area, plus adequate turnaround area shall be provided. Minimum parking for in-home daycares
may be reduced to one (1) space per facility vehicle, one (1) space per employee, and two (2) additional
spaces.
F. There may be one (1) freestanding monument sign erected per public street frontage. The sign(s) for
centers located in Non-Residential Zoning Districts shall not exceed three (3) feet in height and fifteen
(15) sq. ft. in sign area when located within ten (10) feet of the right-of-way. When located more than
ten (10) feet from the right-of-way, the sign(s) shall not exceed five (5) feet in height and fifteen (15)
sq. ft. in sign area. The sign(s) for centers located in Residential Zoning District shall not exceed four
(4) sq. Ft.
G. All required State, Federal, and/or County licenses and permits shall be obtained by the operator of the
day care center.
H. Facilities permitted in any residential district shall maintain the character and appearance of a
residential use.
I. Child Care Facilities must meet the standards provided by the Child Day Care Commission. Evidence
that Commission requirements are met shall be presented to the Zoning Administrator prior to any
Certificate of Zoning Compliance being issued.
Section 8.12 Drinking Places (Alcoholic Beverages)
A. No bar, nightclub, or dance hall shall be permitted within 100 feet of any one- or two-family primary
residential dwelling unit, church, or other civic use building, nor shall a drinking place be located within
100 feet of any other drinking establishment. The restriction of this subsection is not applicable within
the C-B zoning district for structures which front Main Street.
B. Flashing lights or fluttering devices designed and used to attract attention are not permitted.
C. Music or other amplified sound shall not be audible beyond the property line.
8-8
Town of China Grove Unified Development Ordinance

NEW PAGE 124
CHAPTER 8: SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS
D. Plans shall include hours of operation to ensure compatibility to neighboring businesses.
Section 8.13 Drive-Throughs
A. Drive-throughs and service windows shall not front on the primary public street.
B. Drive-through services are only permitted within NC and HB Zoning Districts.
C. Drive-throughs located on the side of a building shall be limited to one no more than two lanes, except
for Financial Institutes (NAICS 52) in a HB District which are subject to the following requirements:
1. The drive-through canopy must be recessed from the front façade
2. Multi-lane drive-throughs are limited to four lanes including the ATM lane.
3. A landscaped island must separate the drive-through and stacking lanes from parking areas and
driveways. The landscaping is subject to the standards of Chapter 7 of this ordinance. The
landscaping shall screen the drive-through and stacking lanes from view from abutting
properties with no openings greater than 4 feet.
4.
At least 75% of the landscaping shall be evergreens. A landscaping plan is required and must
be approved by Technical Review Committee or the Planning Board.
5. Adequate stacking space for drive-through lanes must be provided and approved by the TRC.
6. When located on a corner lot, multi-lane drive-throughs shall not be located on the exterior
building side which fronts the secondary public street.
D. Loudspeakers shall be located at least 50 feet from any pre-existing residential structure located in a
residential district.
E. Stand-alone ATMs may be permitted as accessory uses (i.e., in a shopping center parking lot).
F. Vehicle storage for drive-throughs shall be located outside of and physically separated from the right-
of-way of any street. This area shall not interfere with the efficient internal circulation of traffic on the
site, adjacent property, or adjacent street right-of-way.
G. Drive-through window facilities shall be screened from off-site view by Type B landscaping.
Section 8.14 Duplexes (Two-Family Attached Dwellings)
A. Developments consisting only of duplexes are not permitted on lots greater than three (3) acres.
B. Duplex developments must be visually compatible with the surrounding neighborhood.
C. Duplexes on corner lots shall be designed in a way that each unit fronts on a different street.
8-9
Town of China Grove Unified Development Ordinance

NEW PAGE 125
CHAPTER 8: SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS
Section 8.15 Electronic Gaming Operations
An electronic gaming operation is any business enterprise, whether as a primary or an accessory use, where
persons utilize electronic machines, including but not limited to computers and gaming terminals, to
conduct games of chance, including sweepstakes, internet cafes, and internet business centers and where
cash, merchandise or other items of value are redeemed or otherwise distributed, whether or not the value
of such distribution is determined by electronic games played or by predetermined odds. This does not
include any lottery approved by the State of North Carolina.
A. No Electronic Gaming Operation shall be located within five hundred (500) feet of a church, school,
daycare, community center or any residentially zoned property, nor shall an electronic gaming
operation be located within one thousand (1000) feet of any other such use. These distances shall be
measured from the property line of the proposed facility to the property line of a church, school,
daycare, community center, any residentially zoned property, or the property line of any other electronic
gaming establishment.
B. Activities taking place on the premises shall be confined to the area inside the structure and shall not
be visible from the street right-of-way. No outdoor loitering shall be permitted.
C. The maximum number of gaming computers, stations, machines and/or terminals within an electronic
gaming establishment is twenty (20).
D. All electronic gaming computers, stations, machines and/or terminals shall be visible from the main
entrance of the establishment.
E. Electronic Gaming Operations approved under this Special Use Permit shall be supervised and operated
by a person over 21-years of age who:
has not been convicted or plead guilty or no contest to any criminal offense involving moral
turpitude, gambling or the unlawful possession, sale, distribution, or use of any alcoholic beverage
or controlled substance within the five (5) years next preceding the date of the application for a
Special Use Permit; and
is a resident of North Carolina or does have a registered agent in North Carolina who is authorized
to accept service of process.
F. Neon or flashing lights or fluttering devices designed and used to attract attention are not permitted.
G. Amplification of sound directed outside of the building used by the establishment is not permitted.
H. There shall be one (1) paved parking space for every terminal, machine, and computer or one (1) space
per one hundred (100) square feet of total floor area, whichever is greater; and one (1) paved parking
space per employee. Designated parking spaces shall not include parking spaces allocated to other
businesses within a combined development.
I.
The Electronic Gaming Operation shall comply with all applicable laws of the State of North Carolina.
8-10
Town of China Grove Unified Development Ordinance

NEW PAGE 119
CHAPTER 8: SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS
G. An accessory structure may not exceed the height of the principal structure.
H. On any lot one (1) acre or less in area containing a principal residential use, the total area of all
accessory structures (excluding outdoor swimming pools) shall not exceed one-half (1/2) the total area
of the principal structure.
I.
Satellite dishes do not require a zoning permit and shall be regulated as follows:
Satellite dishes shall be no larger than two (2) feet in diameter unless the applicant can demonstrate
the need for a larger size.
Satellite dishes whose reflective surface is solid shall be painted a subdued or natural color.
J.
Under no circumstances may a vehicle, trailer, or manufactured home be used as an accessory structure.
K. Any accessory structures in R-M zoning meeting the UDO requirements for accessory structures
which existed prior to April 5, 2022 shall be considered legally nonconforming. Additionally, new
accessory structures developed in conjunction with R-M development meeting the requirements of
Section 7.5.5 (special provisions for lots with total square footage of less than 20,000sf
in R-M zoning) shall be permitted by right.
Section 8.4 Adult Establishments
A. No adult establishment shall be located less than 1,000 ft from a school, church, day care center, youth
camp, community center, civic building, park, lot in residential use, lot with residential districting or
other adult establishment. No adult establishment shall be located less than 1,000 ft from any other
adult entertainment establishment.
B. No more than one (1) adult establishment may be located within the same structure or on the same
deeded lot.
C. All openings shall be constructed SO as to prevent visibility of the interior from outside the building.
D. One (1) ground sign per street front shall be permitted with a maximum of twelve (12) sq. ft. in size.
The sign may be indirectly lighted and must be located a minimum of five (5) ft off the road right-of-
way. No sign shall be located on premises which flashes, revolves, rotates, or swings by mechanical
means (lights must be motionless) or which uses a change of lighting to depict action or to create a
special effect or scene. No exterior signage or building element shall be pornographic in nature or
convey any such idea or element. All signs are also subject to provisions of Chapter 11 Signs.
E. Building colors shall be muted and naturally occurring earth tones. Bright and highly reflective or
extremely shiny finishes are prohibited unless used sparingly with an approved architectural plan.
F. Neon or flashing lights or fluttering devices designed and used to attract attention are not permitted.
No color outdoor lighting shall be permitted.
G. Amplification of sound directed outside of the building used by the establishment is not permitted.
8-4
Town of China Grove Unified Development Ordinance

NEW PAGE 120
CHAPTER 8: SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS
Section 8.5 Agricultural Uses
A. Accessory uses/structures and outdoor storage associated with agricultural uses on properties of greater
than one (1) acre are permitted subject to the issuance of a zoning permit and are not subject the
requirements of Section 4.3. However, they are subject to the accessory structure setbacks for their
respective zoning districts.
B. Existing agricultural uses in the R-S district may continue and expand on the same property. An
agricultural use is considered existing if a property has received agricultural property tax status any
time within the last five (5) years. New agricultural uses may be established in the R-S Suburban
Residential District subject to the issuance of a Special Use Permit.
C. Property within the Town's extra-territorial jurisdiction and used for bona fide farm purposes is exempt
from the zoning requirements of this ordinance to the same extent bona fide farming activities are
exempt from county zoning pursuant to NC GS 160D-903(a). NCGS 160D-903 (c) defines property
as a single tract of property, or an identifiable portion of a single tract of property. Property that ceases
to be used for bona fide farm purposes shall become subject to the requirements of this ordinance. Bona
fide farms in the extra-territorial jurisdiction are subject to Rowan County's Flood Damage Prevention
Ordinance and floodplain development permitting.
D. Beekeeping:
A single parcel may have up to five (5) hives.
The hive must be placed at ground level or securely attached to an anchor or stand.
The hive must be placed behind the residence and shall be not less than fifty (50) feet from any
property line.
The hive must be removed if the owner no longer maintains the hive or if removal is necessary to
protect the health, safety, and welfare of the public.
Section 8.6 Animal Slaughtering and Processing
A. Minimum tract size - 10 acres
B. Minimum perimeter setbacks - 100 feet
C. No such operation shall be located within 1,000 feet of any residential zoning district.
D. No open lagoons shall be permitted.
E. A refuse and waste storage plan (collection and disposal plan) must be submitted and approved by the
Board prior to issuance of a special use permit.
F. No livestock shall be permitted to be stored overnight.
G. Any structures which may be deemed noxious, toxic, or offensive by reason of odor, dust, vibration,
smoke, gas, or fumes shall require abatement plans for such nuisances for the protection of public
health, safety, and welfare.
8-5
Town of China Grove Unified Development Ordinance

NEW PAGE 121
CHAPTER 8: SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS
H. All animals awaiting processing are to be housed within a fully enclosed structure.
I.
All inedible offal, meat that is not food, condemned material and refuse of the meat processing shall
be refrigerated and stored in the interior of a full enclosed structure until time of pick-up or final
disposal.
Section 8.7 Automotive, Boat, Recreational Vehicles (RV), Heavy Equipment,
Manufactured Home Sales and/or Service and Commercial Parking Lots
A. Large surface parking lots & display areas should be visually and functionally segmented into several
smaller lots. The size of any single surface parking lot or display area shall be limited to three (3) acres,
unless divided by a street, principal building, or an opaque screen/buffer. Parking lots and display areas
shall be paved. Street-facing parking lot and display areas shall have a Street Planting Yard installed
as described in Section 11.3.4
B. No outdoor sound system shall be permitted which can be heard beyond the boundaries of the property.
C. Shall comply with all applicable provisions of this ordinance, including but not limited to Chapter 8
Parking and Infrastructure.
D. Commercial parking lots, as a primary use, shall require Conditional Rezoning a Special Use Permit in
the CB District.
Section 8.8 Bed and Breakfast Homes and Inns
A bed & breakfast home is a use that takes place within a building that prior to such an establishment, was
a single-family residence, that consists of renting from one (1) to eight (8) dwelling rooms on a daily basis
to tourists, vacationers, and business travelers, where meals are provided only to guests. A bed & breakfast
inn is a business establishment of more than nine (9) guest rooms that offers bed and breakfast
accommodations to at least nine but not more than twenty-three (23) persons.
A. Single family homes used as bed and breakfast homes shall have a minimum heated floor area of 1,500
square feet.
B. The maximum number of guest bedrooms for each proposed bed and breakfast home shall be four (4)
unless the applicant can demonstrate that the original floor plan of the structure contained a larger
number of bedrooms, in which case, the original number of bedrooms may be approved as allowable
guest lodging. In no case shall the number of guests exceed eight (8). The maximum number of
guest bedrooms for each proposed bed and breakfast inn shall be nine (9).
C. The home or inn shall be operated by a resident manager (shall be a full-time resident).
D. All guest parking shall be to the rear of the home. There shall be one parking space per room of lodging.
E. Signs for bed and breakfast homes and inns shall be limited to one ground sign per establishment. Such
sign shall not exceed five (5) square feet unless approved by the Zoning Administrator. The sign shall

search_matches.text:
NEW PAGE 120
CHAPTER 8: SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS
Section 8.5 Agricultural Uses
A. Accessory uses/structures and outdoor storage associated with agricultural uses on properties of greater
than one (1) acre are permitted subject to the issuance of a zoning permit and are not subject the
requirements of Section 4.3. However, they are subject to the accessory structure setbacks for their
respective zoning districts.
B. Existing agricultural uses in the R-S district may continue and expand on the same property. An
agricultural use is considered existing if a property has received agricultural property tax status any
time within the last five (5) years. New agricultural uses may be established in the R-S Suburban
Residential District subject to the issuance of a Special Use Permit.
C. Property within the Town's extra-territorial jurisdiction and used for bona fide farm purposes is exempt
from the zoning requirements of this ordinance to the same extent bona fide farming activities are
exempt from county zoning pursuant to NC GS 160D-903(a). NCGS 160D-903 (c) defines property
as a single tract of property, or an identifiable portion of a single tract of property. Property that ceases
to be used for bona fide farm purposes shall become subject to the requirements of this ordinance. Bona
fide farms in the extra-territorial jurisdiction are subject to Rowan County's Flood Damage Prevention
Ordinance and floodplain development permitting.
D. Beekeeping:
A single parcel may have up to five (5) hives.
The hive must be placed at ground level or securely attached to an anchor or stand.
The hive must be placed behind the residence and shall be not less than fifty (50) feet from any
property line.
The hive must be removed if the owner no longer maintains the hive or if removal is necessary to
protect the health, safety, and welfare of the public.
Section 8.6 Animal Slaughtering and Processing
A. Minimum tract size - 10 acres
B. Minimum perimeter setbacks - 100 feet
C. No such operation shall be located within 1,000 feet of any residential zoning district.
D. No open lagoons shall be permitted.
E. A refuse and waste storage plan (collection and disposal plan) must be submitted and approved by the
Board prior to issuance of a special use permit.
F. No livestock shall be permitted to be stored overnight.
G. Any structures which may be deemed noxious, toxic, or offensive by reason of odor, dust, vibration,
smoke, gas, or fumes shall require abatement plans for such nuisances for the protection of public
health, safety, and welfare.
8-5
Town of China Grove Unified Development Ordinance

NEW PAGE 121
CHAPTER 8: SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS
H. All animals awaiting processing are to be housed within a fully enclosed structure.
I.
All inedible offal, meat that is not food, condemned material and refuse of the meat processing shall
be refrigerated and stored in the interior of a full enclosed structure until time of pick-up or final
disposal.
Section 8.7 Automotive, Boat, Recreational Vehicles (RV), Heavy Equipment,
Manufactured Home Sales and/or Service and Commercial Parking Lots
A. Large surface parking lots & display areas should be visually and functionally segmented into several
smaller lots. The size of any single surface parking lot or display area shall be limited to three (3) acres,
unless divided by a street, principal building, or an opaque screen/buffer. Parking lots and display areas
shall be paved. Street-facing parking lot and display areas shall have a Street Planting Yard installed
as described in Section 11.3.4
B. No outdoor sound system shall be permitted which can be heard beyond the boundaries of the property.
C. Shall comply with all applicable provisions of this ordinance, including but not limited to Chapter 8
Parking and Infrastructure.
D. Commercial parking lots, as a primary use, shall require Conditional Rezoning a Special Use Permit in
the CB District.
Section 8.8 Bed and Breakfast Homes and Inns
A bed & breakfast home is a use that takes place within a building that prior to such an establishment, was
a single-family residence, that consists of renting from one (1) to eight (8) dwelling rooms on a daily basis
to tourists, vacationers, and business travelers, where meals are provided only to guests. A bed & breakfast
inn is a business establishment of more than nine (9) guest rooms that offers bed and breakfast
accommodations to at least nine but not more than twenty-three (23) persons.
A. Single family homes used as bed and breakfast homes shall have a minimum heated floor area of 1,500
square feet.
B. The maximum number of guest bedrooms for each proposed bed and breakfast home shall be four (4)
unless the applicant can demonstrate that the original floor plan of the structure contained a larger
number of bedrooms, in which case, the original number of bedrooms may be approved as allowable
guest lodging. In no case shall the number of guests exceed eight (8). The maximum number of
guest bedrooms for each proposed bed and breakfast inn shall be nine (9).
C. The home or inn shall be operated by a resident manager (shall be a full-time resident).
D. All guest parking shall be to the rear of the home. There shall be one parking space per room of lodging.
E. Signs for bed and breakfast homes and inns shall be limited to one ground sign per establishment. Such
sign shall not exceed five (5) square feet unless approved by the Zoning Administrator. The sign shall
8-6
Town of China Grove Unified Development Ordinance

NEW PAGE 122
CHAPTER 8: SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS
not be illuminated and shall be an identification sign only. Location of sign shall be governed by
Chapter 11 Signs. No advertising signs of any nature shall be permitted.
F. Bed and breakfast homes shall be located in a structure which was originally constructed as a dwelling.
G. The use shall contain only one (1) kitchen facility. Meals served on the premises shall be only for
overnight guests and residents of the facility.
H. The use of such a facility by any one patron shall be limited to no more than 15 days per 60-day period.
Section 8.9 Boarding Houses
A. The maximum number of guest bedrooms for each proposed boarding house shall be four (4) unless
the applicant can demonstrate that the original floor plan of the structure contained a larger number of
bedrooms, in which case, the original number of bedrooms may be approved as allowable guest
lodging. In no case shall the number of guest rooms exceed eight (8).
B. The boarding house shall be operated by a resident manager.
C.
The use shall be located in a structure which was originally constructed as a dwelling.
D.
The use shall contain only one (1) kitchen facility. Meals served on the premises shall be only for
overnight guests and residents of the facility.
E. All resident parking shall be to the rear of the home. There shall be one parking space per room of
residency.
F.
Signs for boarding houses shall be limited to one ground sign per establishment. Such sign shall not
exceed five (5) square feet and shall not be illuminated and shall be an identification sign only.
Location of sign shall be governed by Chapter 11 Signs. No advertising signs of any nature shall be
permitted.
Section 8.10 Cemeteries
A. Tombstones, crypts, monuments, and mausoleums shall be located a minimum of 20 feet from any side
or rear lot line and at least 30 feet from a street right-of-way.
B. Adequate off-street parking/circulation facilities for funeral procession shall be provided.
C. Site plans shall also include entrances and exits, pattern of internal circulation and storm drainage.
D. Cemeteries shall have direct access to a major or minor thoroughfare.
8-7
Town of China Grove Unified Development Ordinance
